item.title: Ticket #1770 (Collapsing tree-view functionality in Page Management tool) created
item.author: mike.matz@â€¦
item.description: There should be some form of pagination in this tool -- ideally a tree view structure that by default collapses all branches of the tree. It is difficult to navigate within this tool when working on sites that have hundreds of pages.

item.title: Ticket #1769 (Don't ping on import) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: I imported my old blogspot blog into a new WP blog and experienced lots of hanging connections in the backend. I debugged it and it appears that WordPress is trying to ping all the URLs in the posts I imported. URLs shouldn't be pinged again on import.

item.title: Ticket #1768 (Massive Code Cleanup: template-functions-general.php and ...) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Part III of the Massive Code Cleanup series, taking on template-functions-general.php and template-functions-links.php

As before, the bulk of the work is:

  • spaces to tabs
  • two newlines between functions
  • brackets removed for one-line if ()s
  • \t\n => \n
  • [space]\n => \n
  • \t[space] => \t
  • no cramming two lines into one.
  • $id and $post declared global in function, when $post has $post->ID
  • if/else bracket tab matching
  • foreach : endforeach; and if : else; are for front-of-house code only
  • clean spacing for if, foreach, and for: if ( $condition ) {
  • if ( $something == 'value' ) => if ( 'value' == $something ) as per coding guidelines

item.title: Ticket #1767 (Admin form submissions with errors should re-populate form data) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
A good example of this is on the Users page. If one tries to add a user and forgets to put in an email address, an error is presented: "ERROR: please type an e-mail address", but the submitted form data is gone (nickname, first name, password, etc.).

All of the data that is submitted along with the form should be re-populated into the form fields in the case of an error.

item.title: wp-grammar.diff attached to Ticket #1766
item.dc:creator: h3h

item.title: Ticket #1766 (Grammar correction in admin error text) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
"If this file was writable you could edit it." should be "If this file were writable you could edit it." It's a hypothetical, not past tense.

Attaching patch.

item.title: Ticket #1765 (Simplify and standardize anchor syntax) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
n a semi-recent changeset [2906], there are anchors that are being created on the admin post page. I've also seen more recent patches with the same. The HTML uses the following syntax:

<a id="preview-post"></a>

I am wondering why this specific syntax is being used instead of simply adding the same id to the h2 element itself, like so:

<h2 id="preview-post"><?php _e('Post Preview (updated when post is saved)'); ?> ...

As far as I know, using the A element for anchoring is a thing of the past, and even then it was <a name="..."> (an empty element without the closing </a>).

Clarification on this usage would be appreciated and I think it would be good to establish a product-wide standard for anchor syntax (if one doesn't already exist).

item.title: Ticket #1763 (Link visibility radiobuttons belong to two different classes) updated
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
Index: edit-link-form.php
===================================================================
--- edit-link-form.php  (revision 2951)
+++ edit-link-form.php  (working copy)
@@ -216,7 +216,7 @@
            <td><label>
              <input type="radio" name="link_visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'Y') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="Y" />
 <?php _e('Yes') ?></label><br /><label>
-<input type="radio" name="visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'N') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="N" />
+<input type="radio" name="link_visible" <?php if ($link->link_visible == 'N') echo "checked='checked'"; ?> value="N" />
 <?php _e('No') ?></label></td>
          </tr>
 </table>

item.title: Ticket #1763 (Link visibility radiobuttons belong to two different classes) created
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
{{{ <td><label>

<input type="radio" name="link_visible" value="Y" />

Yes</label><br /><label> <input type="radio" name="visible" checked='checked' value="N" /> No</label></td> }}} This is on the Edit Link page, at the bottom. You can't set a link to visible because the names are incompatible.
